content:
AI for Good Webinar - Friday 27 March, 13 CET
COVID-19 Case Study: Using ICT & AI to flatten the COVID-19 curve in the Republic of Korea

http://itu.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=b23162b8ac4b0101596744c73&id=0841677ccf&e=094a277165

Home - AI for Good Global Summit
We have less than 10 years to solve the SDGs and AI holds great promise. The AI for Good Global Summit is THE leading action-oriented, global & inclusive United Nations platform on AI. The Summit is organized by the ITU with XPRIZE Foundation, in partnership with UN Sister Agencies, Switzerland and ACM.

SciDip Talks: Online talks on global health, science diplomacy and technology

Free online talks by leading world experts in global health, science diplomacy, geopolitics and technology. This initiative will consist of 5 sessions that will take place every Thursday at 6pm (CET/CEST) (March 26th, April 2nd, 9th, 16th and 23rd)
http://www.scitechdiplohub.org/SciDipTalks

WEBINAR: "COVID19 Crisis: Global Crisis, Global Risk and Global Consequences" discussing the "Strategic Implications of the Coronavirus Crisis." 2nd April 14h (CET)

The webinar is organized by the Geneva Center for Security Policy, a key supporter of the CLAIRE Office Switzerland

The webinar is free and conducted in English. The first webinar session will provide an overview of the strategic, global health security, crisis management, governance, economic and financial implications of this crisis.

https://bit.ly/2UIpvZ0

Covid-19 | Strategic implications of the Coronavirus crisis
Covid-19 Crisis: Global Crisis, Global Risk and Global Consequences is a four-module webinar series examines the visible, strategic implications of the current coronavirus crisis on society
